about.title: About LEARN
about.description: LEARN is a bilingual quiz and flashcard application designed to help you master any topic using science-backed spaced repetition.
about.intro: LEARN is a bilingual (English/Spanish) quiz and flashcard application designed to help you master any topic using science-backed spaced repetition. Whether you're studying vaccines, languages, or any subject, LEARN adapts to your memory patterns for optimal long-term retention.
about.fsrsIntro: LEARN uses FSRS-6 (Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler), the latest version of a modern, research-backed algorithm for optimizing when you review material. With 21 trainable parameters, it automatically adapts to your individual memory patterns.
about.fsrsCoreIdea: The core idea is simple: review information just before you're about to forget it. FSRS tracks how well you remember each card and schedules the next review at the optimal time:
about.newCards: New cards appear frequently at first
about.difficultCards: Difficult cards you struggle with show up more often
about.easyCards: Easy cards you know well appear at longer intervals
about.masteredCards: Mastered cards may only need review every few months
about.fsrsEfficiency: This approach is dramatically more efficient than re-reading or cramming — you spend your time exactly where it's needed most. With FSRS, users need 20–30% fewer reviews than traditional methods for the same retention level.
about.faqFsrsQuestion: What makes FSRS different from other flashcard apps?
about.faqFsrsAnswer: FSRS-6 is the latest version of the Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler, with 21 trainable parameters including a trainable forgetting curve decay. It outperforms traditional systems like SM-2 (used by Anki's default) using machine learning principles to predict when you'll forget something. LEARN automatically optimizes these parameters for your personal review history, resulting in even fewer reviews needed to maintain the same retention. <link>More details here</link>.
about.faqAnonymousQuestion: Can I use LEARN without creating an account?
about.faqAnonymousAnswer: Yes! You can try LEARN as a guest. Your progress will be saved, and you can upgrade to a full account at any time to ensure your data is permanently saved.
about.faqBilingualAnswer: All content in LEARN is available in both English and Spanish. You can switch languages at any time using the language switcher in the navigation bar. Your preference is saved to your profile.
about.faqProgressAnswer: Every time you review a flashcard, FSRS updates your card state. Cards progress through states: New → Learning → Review → Mastered. You can see your progress on the topic selection page.
about.faqSuspendQuestion: What does suspending a flashcard do?
about.faqSuspendAnswer: Suspending a flashcard removes it from your review queue. This is useful for cards you find too easy, too hard, or irrelevant. You can unsuspend them from Settings at any time.
about.faqDataAnswer: Your data is stored securely in Supabase with row-level security (RLS). Only you can access your progress, preferences, and review history. We never share your data with third parties.
about.faqOptimizationAnswer: The app analyzes your review history using a Rust-based optimizer engine. After 50 or more reviews, it trains 21 parameters specific to your memory patterns. This happens automatically — no setup needed. Default parameters (derived from hundreds of millions of reviews) are used until you have enough data. The result is more efficient scheduling with fewer unnecessary reviews.
about.faqFsrs6Answer: FSRS-6 is the latest version of the Free Spaced Repetition Scheduler, featuring 21 trainable parameters (up from 19 in FSRS-5). The key improvement is a trainable forgetting curve decay — the algorithm learns how quickly your memory fades, rather than assuming everyone forgets at the same rate. It also has improved same-day review handling for learning-phase cards. FSRS is used by Anki and other major flashcard platforms. <link>Learn more about the algorithm</link>.
about.faqTechQuestion: What technology powers the spaced repetition?
about.faqTechAnswer: Two open-source packages, both from the open-spaced-repetition project created by Jarrett Ye (L-M-Sherlock), the researcher behind the FSRS algorithm. ts-fsrs is the TypeScript implementation that handles card scheduling, state transitions, interval calculations, and fuzz. @open-spaced-repetition/binding provides Rust napi-rs bindings to the fsrs-rs optimizer engine — it trains personalized FSRS weights from your review history using Maximum Likelihood Estimation and Backpropagation Through Time. Both packages come from the same team that developed FSRS as a modern replacement for Anki's legacy SM-2 algorithm.
